list_definition.definition: (sometimes with with) to hold different opinions etc (from someone else)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I disagree with you on that point.

list_definition.definition: (with with) (of food) to be unsuitable (to someone) and cause pain

list_ex_of_english: The author disagreed with him by expressing that health is not the only relevant 'outcome' of any health care system.
Indeed, members of the tsarist government and academics often disagreed about possible areas of co-operation.
A low score denotes a negative attitude ; either agreeing with a negatively biased statement or disagreeing with a positively biased statement.
When he disagrees with another authority, the topic will be confined to fact, not opinion.
Occasionally, we sought outside advice, but mostly we took our own decisions and very seldom disagreed about what these should be.
I disagreed, believing that a full account of the background issues was needed, as well as my summary of the available evidence.
Actors disagreed on the information needed and the norms at stake.
In cases where the raters disagreed the final rating was made by consensus, including the opinion of a third member of the group of reviewers.
